channel.title: PhD blog on Koh Yamakawa
channel.description: Recent content in PhD blog on Koh Yamakawa

item.title: Year 1: Winterbreak
item.description: With COVID, I didn’t go home for the winter break. But I wasn’t sad. I got the Graduate Remote Instructor Fellowship to study different ways of planning for the (hopefully last) remote semester. I got to seemy partner a lot and explored Berkeley as much as we could. I even got work on my Taiko. It was nice. Living alone Once my suite mate left for home in late November for the Thanksgiving holidays, I was by myself!

item.title: First Semester: Fall 2020
item.description: Hello folks! Welcome to the first posting in my PhD blog. I hope to continue this throughout my five year journey. This last year has been an ordeal. I had graduated Columbia at the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic taking my commencement ceremony sitting on my couch at home. We took the 2-3 hours to listen to the commencement ceremony and that was it: the ending of my undergraduate career. It felt a bit empty but it was that way for everyone.
